comment.author: 9737230@N07
comment._content: From the viewpoint on Hwy.99. at Oregon City,Oregon

comment.author: 9737230@N07
comment._content: The paper mill on the other side of the river was Crown Zellerbach for 60 some years. My Grandfather told me ( long ago) that when they (<- ?) were clearing the land to build the mill that children who lived in the area would get a penny a piece for arrowheads they could find. At one time this was quite the gathering place for several of the different Indian Tribes of the area. At the end of the Oregon Trail. West Linn is on the other side of the river.
